message.content:
cs.FL, cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.IT, cs.LO

The paper deals with the minimum number of states required for a DFA to separate two strings, which is a topic in formal language theory (cs.FL). It also mentions an open problem related to separating words, which is a topic in discrete mathematics (cs.DM). The paper uses techniques from graph theory and combinatorics, which are also relevant to the sub-categories of cs.CC (computational complexity) and cs.LO (logic in computer science). Finally, the paper discusses the use of information theory in the context of separating words, which makes cs.IT (information theory) a possible sub-category as well.
